Name: Hour of Need: Divine Law
Description:
Divine Law is an optional Kickstarter exclusive add-on for the Hour of Need board game.

This add-on is a stand-alone two-player version of Hour of Need, which includes 2 new heroes, a new villain, new minions and a new story campaign all complete with their respective cards.

Name: Tramways: Busan/Halle Merseburg
Description:
Expansion for Tramways:


     Busan map with an airport and special rules for the parks (green areas)
     Halle Merseburg with a long already printed line that each player can use to cross the city.

Name: KinderPerfect: Naughty
Description:
For edgy parents who can laugh at darker kid-centric experiences.

Add these hilarious cards to the main KinderPerfect game for more laughter! 25 Red Question Cards and 75 White Answer Cards. All cards crowdsourced from real parents just like you.

Name: Major Arcana: The Tarot Game
Description:
Work out which cards to discard from other’s hands, to be the last one holding cards and win.
Players try to remember the remaining cards from numbers declared already.

The cards are based on the Major arcana of the tarot cards.

Name: The Road So Far
Description:
A quick play, family friendly card game.
Take the Impala out around the country to collect groups – Angels, Demons, Hunters, Allies, Family, and two brothers. The player with the majority of groups at the end of the road wins. The Road So Far is a casual card game for 2-4 players.

The Road So Far is a card game for 2-4 players; recommended 8 and up.  Players take turns as “driver” of the Impala “travelling” on the board to collect character cards.  Once the majority of a group is collected, “mayhem” ensues.  Play continues until the Impala can no longer move.   At that time, the player that has the majority of group markers wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Gromino des oiseaux
Description:
The game contains 41 cards with pictures (and 2 cards with rules). The aim of the game is to take the most possible cards to win. Cards are mixed and then equally distributed to players. The remaining cards are replaced in the box. Players pile their cards in front of them without looking at them.

The youngest player starts and places the first card of his stack visible on the table. The player sitting to his left lays a card in turn and so on. The cards placed remain on the table until one of the players can make a take.

Immediately after playing, the player carefully looks at all the cards on the table. If the card he has just placed ends a meeting (all the drawings of several cards are all on one card), he picks up all the cards of the meeting and puts them in front of him. Cards that are not part of the meeting remain on the table. Attention: if a player lays a card without realizing that he is holding a meeting, the next player has the right to pick up the cards by appropriating the take.

When no more takes are possible or when the players no longer have cards, the game is over. Everyone counts the cards he has taken and the player who took the most card wins the game.

Name: Cirk
Description:
Original game title - Ñ†Ð¸Ñ€Ðº (eng. - Circus).
Typical chutes ladders type board game made in Russia. 
Game is based by silent film written, produced, and directed (1928) by Charlie Chaplin - The Circus.
The first player, who cross 100 stops road - wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Morituri Te Salutant
Description:
Morituri Te Salutant is a set of miniature wargame rules to simulate 1 on 1 gladiator fighting in a Roman arena.

Game Sequence:

     Release attempt
     1st Initiative and Movements
     2nd Initiative and Movements
     Throw phase
     Corps-a-corps


Published in French in Vae Victis magazine.

—user summary

Name: Guerre éclair: ¡No Pasarán!
Description:
¡No Pasarán! is the first module for Guerre éclair, simple miniature wargame rules to simulate combats in the first half of the 20th century, where each player handles the equivalent of a division. It uses special command cards and a standard 32 cards deck.

For minis from 1/300 to 1/72

Sequence of play:
Command phase - only beginning of game, then:

     activation of units (using the 32 cards)
     orders
     movements
     combat


Scale:
1 cm = 50m
1 mini = ~60 men
1 model = ~10 vehicles

Published in French in Vae Victis magazine.

—user summary

Name: Guerre éclair II: France 40
Description:
France 40 is the second module for Guerre éclair, simple miniature wargame rules to simulate combats in the first half of the 20th century, where each player handles the equivalent of a division. It uses special command cards and a standard 32 cards deck.

For minis from 1/300 to 1/72

Sequence of play:
Command phase - only beginning of game, then:

     activation of units (using the regular cards)
     orders
     movements
     combat


Scale:
1 cm = 50m
1 mini = ~60 men
1 model = ~10 vehicles

Published in French in Vae Victis magazine.

—user summary

Name: Orages d'Acier: Les Aigles Attaquent
Description:
Orages d'Acier is a simple skimish miniature ruleset for combat in the trenches during WWI, at the squad level.

This expansion adds rules and stats for Sopwith, SPAD, Albatros...

Published in French in Vae Victis magazine.

Name: Das Vogelspiel
Description:
The players have to move their bird on their own five spaces long track into the nest. Movement is determined by two dice.
On the roll of 7 or more the bird may move 1 space. If two identical numbers (doubles) are rolled, the bird advances two spaces.

The first player whose bird reaches the nest wins the game.

The game continues until all birds have reached the nest.

—user summary

Name: La Princesse aux Echelles
Description:
Princess Ladder is a cooperative and communication limited cardgame, for 3-6 players.

Based on a princess-abducted-by-dragon story, the game drives the players to the highest window of dungeons, where 4 sisters princesses are to be saved, by using numerical ladder cards. The active player knows (most of time) the exact height and asks others for the good card to add to his own ladder. Alas, he can only speak with 2 words : “More” or “Less”. More, the princess as well as the current page of the story book tell the players how to save her.

When each player ended the round, ladders are added and the total is compared to the dungeon height. If equal, princess is saved, otherwise, dragon takes the princess away and players turn another page of the story book. At the end of the book, if all princesses are not saved, the game is over and lost.

There’s some variant rules in the booklet to increase game length and/or difficulty.

-description from publisher

Name: L' Empire Des Mers
Description:
L'empire des mers is a simple miniature tactical naval wargame rule for the period 1740-1815

Play sequence:

     Wind - sails setup
     Command phase
     Movement phase
     Boarding preparation phase
     Firing phase
     Boarding and mêlées
     Sails selection and ammo phase


—user summary

Name: Elementals Unleashed
Description:
The chemical elements make up all the things around us (including us!) – they are the building blocks of nature. Now you can use the elements like never before – and Battle, Steal, Block and Heal your way to victory with Elementals Unleashed! The game that brings the Periodic Table to life!

Featuring 32 chemical elements of the Periodic Table, each turned into unique characters (Elementals) with their designs and skills based on their chemical and physical properties, and history. These properties also determine whether an Elemental is classed as Battle: duel another player’s Battle cards; Steal: Attempt to steal from another players hidden hand or Chemical Battlefield; Block: Try to stop the steal!; Heal: replenish your hand with cards from the deck.

How to play:

Each player starts with 4 cards from a shuffled deck, which are hidden from the other players.

The first player draws a card, and depending on what Elementals they have, can either battle, steal, or heal. The success of this depends on the level of the card, and the skill of the Elemental. After a player has used a card, it moves to the Chemical Battlefield in front of the player, becoming visible to all players. However, the cards in the Chemical Battlefield still count towards the players total score.

Battle Elementals are the warriors of the game and are used to duel with other players. When the active player uses a Battle Elemental card their chosen opponent must also produce a Battle Elemental card. Battle Elementals are revealed at the same time and the card with the highest level wins, unless the other Elemental’s special skill gives it an advantage. The winner receives their opponent’s Battle Elemental into their hidden hand, then places their used card into the Chemical Battlefield. When an opponent doesn’t have a battle a card, the active player may take a random card from the opponent’s hidden hand.
Steal Elementals are the thieves of the game and are used to steal other players’ cards. Cards can either be stolen from both the hidden hand – a random selection - or the Chemical Battlefield - where players can choose the card they want. The Steal Elemental will be successful unless their opponent has a Block card.

Block Elementals are the police of the game and are used to prevent the theft of cards. When a player tries to steal from the hidden hand, Block Elementals will always stop any Steal Elemental.  However, a Block Elemental can only prevent stealing from the Chemical Battlefield when the Block level is higher than that of the Steal Elemental.  Block cards must be used when an opponent attempts to steal and are revealed at the same time as the steal card, then moved to the player’s Chemical Battlefield.  In the case of Steal cards with Elemental skill 2x steal, two Block cards must be used. When a player has only Block cards in their hand, they may pick another card from the deck and immediately play it.

Heal Elementals provide the support of the game and allow a new card to be taken from the top of the deck, unless otherwise specified by the Elemental skill.

When a player is asked to battle, or is being stolen from, and they don’t have an appropriate card to retaliate (Battle vs Battle, Block vs Steal), they may take the top card from the deck. If the player can use it, they must do so immediately, however, if not, the card is placed into their Chemical Battlefield.

When there is a draw (Battle vs Battle, Steal vs Block), both cards are moved to the relevant Chemical Battlefield, and the active player’s go is then over.

Cards taken from another player (through stealing or battle) go into the hidden hand.

The game is over once the deck has been depleted, but the last player to draw a card may still play a card from their hand. The players must then count their total points in both their hidden hand and Chemical Battlefield, and the player with the highest score wins.

-description from designer

Name: Guerre éclair III: Nach Paris !
Description:
Nach Paris is the third module for Guerre éclair for the August 1914 campaign during World War I.
Guerre éclair is a simple miniature wargame rules to simulate combats in the first half of the 20th century, where each player handles the equivalent of a division. It uses special command cards, dice and a standard 32 cards deck.

For minis from 1/300 to 1/72

Sequence of play:
Command phase - only beginning of game, then:

     activation of units (using the regular cards)
     orders
     movements
     combat


Scale:
1 cm = 50m
1 mini = ~60 men
1 model = ~10 vehicles

Published in French, in Vae Victis magazine.

—user summary

Name: Bunte Wege
Description:
The players have to move their 9 (2 player game )or 7 pawns from their black starting spaces to the starting spaces of the opposite player. Movement is determined by a number die and a color die. The color die shows two colors on each side. Eeach turn only the spaces of the rolled colors may be used for movement. The first player to get all his pawns on the black destination spaces wins the game.

For the 2 player game the board remains folded and only the middle section is used for play. If more than two players play, the two outmost black spaces on each side of the middle section are not used.

—user summary

Name: Croix de guerre
Description:
Croix de guerre are simple skirmish rules for the period 1915-1945.

For 20/25 mm 1/72 mini

Turn order:
1- action phase of black camp
2- action phase of red camp
3- localization and firing phase of black camp 
4- localization and firing phase of red camp

Scale:
1cm = 2m
1 turn = ~30"
1 mini = a man'

Published in French, in Vae Victis magazine.

—user summary

Name: Les Trois Couleurs
Description:
Les Trois Couleurs is a miniature wargame ruleset on the Napoleonic period.

Fast and historical, it can be used for reconstitution as well as competition.

It presents:

     Universal basing system,
     Operational level,
     Tactical phase, either in a conventional alternate manner, or simultaneous.
     Orders, command structure, generals, formations and movement, fire, corps à corps and moral
     basis elements for campaign games,
     National characteristics,
     for key nations, detailed data (moral and composition) at 25 key battles
     a list of all generals (160+) who commanded a brigade or a corps
     "un état d'esprit"


—user summary

Name: Tanks !
Description:
Tanks !, fast introductive tactical level miniature wargame rules to simulate tank battles in World War 2, published in Vae Victis issue #30.
Published in French.

Allows to play in any scale from 1/300 to 1/72
Each player controls 5-10 tanks.

Turn order:

     6 phases randomly activated depending on cards drawing (3 cards for the Allies, 3 for the Axis)
     when a category is activated: move and fire depending on units abilities


Scale:
1 model = 1 tank
1cm = 20m
1 turn = ~10min
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Tanks!: 2
Description:
Tanks ! 2 is an expansion for Tanks ! fast and simple miniature rules for tank battles in WW2.

It adds optional rules and extra tanks data.

Published in French in Vae Victis magazine.

—user summary

Name: Six dwarves
Description:
Be the first to discover all the numbers from 1 to 6 that the dwarves hide.

The goal of the game is to be the first with all your 6 cards open and without any special cards among them.

Name: La Grande Armée: Furia Francese
Description:
Furia Francese is an expansion for La Grande Armée miniature wargames rules published in Vae Victis magazine 26.

It allows to simulate the battles at the end of the Italian Wars.

Published in French in Vae Victis magazine.

—user summary

Name: La Flèche brisée
Description:
La Flèche brisée, the old west 1850-1890, is a simple miniature skimish wargame rules in the wild west 1850-1890.
It was designed for 25mm 1/72 minis

Sequence of play:

     rally phase
     localization phase
     action phase (movement, fire, melee and charge), alternate


Scale:
1cm = 2m
1mini = 1 individual

Published in French in Vae Victis magazine.

—user summary

Name: Bugs Building
Description: Bugs Building is a twist on Jenga that is perfect for young learners. In this simple game, players take turns rolling the die, then removing a corresponding bug from the tower and placing it on top. The goal is to remove the bugs without toppling the tower.

Name: Espionage: the card game
Description:
An  exciting game of agents and assassins!  You act as Spymasters and send highly skilled agents to complete a mission or thwart your opponent's goal.

The main objective is for a player to force his opponent to discard The Target card by playing different agent cards such as Sniper or Assassin card.  On the other hand, the player holding The Target card must prevent his opponent from forcing him to discard the Target card by playing agents such as Police or Bodyguard until the game ends.

A player can also win the game by playing The Package card or get eliminated in the middle of the game by losing The Package card if he is forced by his opponent to discard it.

The game is dynamic as your mission may change during the game.  You may be trying to eliminate The Target during the start, then may find yourself protecting The Target towards the end.  The game ends when the (52-card deck) draw pile is depleted.  But be careful, the player holding The Bomb card at the end of the game also loses.  Depending on the house rule, a game may have no winner at the end!

—description from the designer

Name: Kingdom of Dyflin
Description:
Kingdom of Dyflin is an expansion to The Great Heathen Army. That game was a collection of Viking land battles set in what would become England. This scenario book expansion provides four new battles set during the same period in Ireland, utilizing the maps and counters from Great Heathen Army.

Cenn Fuait (917) finds the Irish on the offensive until the sudden arrival of enemy reinforcements turns it into a desperate rearguard action. Ath Cliath (919) sees six Irish Kings band together in a disastrous attempt to break Viking power. At Glen Mama (999), rivals Brian Boru and Mael Sechnaill join forces against the rebellious Mael Morda and Sigtrygg Silkbeard, with Dublin as the prize.

And finally, there's Clontarf (1014) - one of the most famous battles in Irish history. This is the big one, folks - the biggest and longest battle in the entirety of the Shields & Swords II series, sprawling across two maps, with over fifty units on a side.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Eye of Judgment: Biolith Rebellion – Series 3
Description:
The third set of cards in this series. Second, and final expansion of the game. Set/Series 3 featured 101 new cards not found in Series 1 or 2.
Booster boxes contained 36 packs of 8 cards each (5 Common cards, 2 Uncommon cards and 1 Rare or Ultra Rare card per pack).
Unlike previous sets, no Pre-Constructed decks were released with the new set.

Purchase of the Set 3 DLC from the PlayStation store was required to use the new cards, although it was not required to play against them (CPU or Player Online). Set 2 DLC purchase was not required to use the Set 3 DLC.

—user summary

Name: Felicior Augusto, Melior Traiano !
Description:
Felicior Augusto, Melior Traiano (Happier than Augustus, Better than Trajan) is a skirmish miniatures rules for the 1st century AD in the Roman Empire.
Designed for 25/30mm miniatures.

Sequence of play:

     Initiative
     Actions (movement, corps-a-corps, throw)
     End of turn


Scale:
1 mini = 1 man
1 cm = 1 m

Published in French in Vae Victis magazine.

—user summary

Name: Tanks!: 3
Description:
Tanks ! 3 the infantry, is an expansion for Tanks ! fast and simple miniature rules for tank battles in WW2.

It adds optional rules and infantry and guns data.

Published in French in Vae Victis magazine.

—user summary

Name: Billy Yank
Description:
Billy Yank is a miniatures wargame ruleset for the American Civil War.
Designed for 20/25mm minis

Sequence of play:

     Orders phase
     Rally phase
     Command phase
     Action phase (charges, melees, maneuvers, stationary units fires...)
     in motion units firing phase


Scale:
Base unit is the regiment (~400 men / ~20minis)
1 step (2.5cm) = ~50m
1 mini = ~20 men
1 game turn = 15 min

Published in French in Vae Victis magazine.

—user summary

Name: Volnitza!
Description:
Volnitza !

Simple miniature wargame rules for the Russian Civil War

For minis: 15 to 60mm

Turn Sequence:

     Orders attribution
     Action Points calculation
     Orders revelation
     Movement and fire step for specific orders 
     Movement and fire step for specific orders
     Movement and fire step for specific orders
     Moral step


Scale:
Brigade or Division

Published in French in Vae Victis magazine.

—user summary

Name: Dungeon Bastards
Description:
Take control of one of the ghouls from Ghoul, then kill and blunder your way through Creepsylvania and throw yourself over the Wall of Death.

Players take turns advancing through a Creepsylvanian map via six-sided dice rolls, and the first one to get to end of the map and jump the Wall of Death wins.

The board for Dungeon Bastards is included on the vinyl album of the same name by Ghoul.  Dice and Ghoul miniatures sold separately.

Name: Histo: Bijbelse helden
Description:
Histo - Bijbelse Helden is a card game for 2-5 players, consisting of 35 character cards (7 sets of 5), 6 role cards and 5 action cards.

Every player receives 5 character cards and a role card. 10-15 remaining character cards are placed face-down at the table in rows of 5 cards each. Every turn a player places a card from his hand on the table and takes the card from that position in his hand. He ends his turn by turning a card in the middle over and making it visible. The players try to collect a group of 5 of the same cards that fit their role card. The first player to achieve that says "Histo" and wins the game. Other players with the same role will be awarded points as well. It's also possible to claim "Histo" when 5 of the same cards are visible in the middle, although fewer points will be awarded to the winners.

Every player receives an action card that can be played once. Players can choose from 4 different high impact actions to turn the tables in their favor. Although the mechanic is accessible and straightforward, there are a lot of different viable tactics possible to win the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Pocket Landship: Driver Danielson promo card
Description:
Kickstarter exclusive promo card with the following unique one time use effect:

INTERCEPTED COMMS.:
Assign Enemy dice in any order

Name: Pocket Landship: Driver C. Andrews promo card
Description:
Kickstarter exclusive promo card with the following unique one time use effect:

Friendly Fire:
Any one enemy attack damages an adjacent Enemy Unit instead of a Player Unit

Name: Winterborne: Loyalty Promo Pack
Description: The Winterborne Loyalty Promo Pack is composed of one Banner set  of three cards and one Wyld card. These items are introduced into the game as per the normal rules.

Name: Escape Room: The Game 2
Description:
Not to be confused with Escape Room: The Game 2, this is actually the Spanish version of Escape Room: The Game (Escape Rooms II).

Both the English and Spanish editions contain Secret Agent, Space Station, and The Dentist, but the Spanish version also contains The Casino.
Families: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

Name: Deadzone: Escalation
Description:
Deadzone Containment Protocols: Escalation is the latest update to the hugely popular sci-fi skirmish game, Deadzone.
In this new supplement, players will find rules for adding ruthless mercenaries to their games and an entirely new mercenary-based faction. Rebs get a boost to their cause with new fighters, while the insidious Veermyn gains the support of the technologically advanced Volt Chasers. Plus, all existing faction lists are reprinted with the latest points and errata. What’s more, you’ll also find new multi-mat based scenarios and rules for adding interactive scenery to your battles.

—description from the publisher

Name: Deadzone: Infestation – Exham IV Expansion
Description:
Brings the battles of Deadzone to a whole new arena. A detailed sourcebook recounts the incident that saw Exham IV become a Deadzone, a rubber mat and detailed scenery combine to recreate the Deadzone and an exclusive metal miniature adds to you collection.

This set contains:
Exham IV Sourcebook
Exham IV Deluxe Rubber Mat
2 x Industrial Walls A
2 x Industrial Walls B
1 x Industrial Accessories A
1 x Industrial Accessories B
1 x Connector Pack
1 x The Piper exclusive metal model with 2 rat swarms

Name: Deadzone: Incoming Intel Deck
Description:
The Incoming Intel Deck is an entirely new way to play Deadzone! Out in the field, you never know what your next target will be and the Incoming Intel Deck represents this with missions that change on the fly. This 66-card deck includes ever-changing objectives and special events that can shape the conflict.
Contents: 66 Incoming Intel Cards. Standard Playing Card Size.

Name: Reise durch Deutschland
Description:
The players start in Hamburg on a round trip through Germany. The first player back in Hamburg wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game was published between 1933 and 1945.

Name: Wunderteam
Description:
The red player begins with the ball on space 1. Movement is determined by a die. On different spaces different game situations affect the movement of the ball. The first player to achieve a agreed upon number of goals wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Ready, Steady, Sculpt!
Description: A fast-paced family party game of modelling charades where players pick a card and model a sculpture in Plasticine that their teammates need to recognise and guess correctly within the given time limit.

Name: Guerre éclair IV: Heia Safari !
Description:
Heia Safari ! is the third module for Guerre éclair  for the North African campaign during World War II.
Ownership of rules published in Vae Victis magazine 20,21,22 is necessary.

Guerre éclair is a simple miniature wargame rules, in French, to simulate combats in the first half of the 20th century, where each player handles the equivalent of a division. It uses special command cards, dice and a standard 32 cards deck.

For minis from 1/300 to 1/72

Sequence of play:
Command phase - only beginning of game, then:

     activation of units (using the regular cards)
     orders
     movements
     combat


Scale:
1 cm = 50m
1 mini = ~60 men
1 model = ~10 vehicles

Name: D-Day Dice (Second Edition): Inside The Bunker
Description:
This expansion for Airborne in your Pocket allows you to combine 2 different games: AIYP and D-Day Dice.

How does it work? Easy: when you play D-Day Dice and your unit enters the bunker, you must play a mini-game of Airborne in your Pocket to see what happens inside!

Also includes cards that can be added to either game:
AIYP: 43 dice-based cards, including a new set of events, new scenarios and many items and Special Ops
D-Day Dice - 12 Airborne-themed awards, items and Specialists.

Do you dare find out what is inside the bunker?

—description from the publisher

Name: Frozen II: Magical Adventure
Description:
A new misfortune has come to the kingdom of Arendelle: the seasons have mixed! Bright spring flowers grow along the snow-covered path and as soon as you come around the corner, yellow leaves begin to fly off trees. Unravel the mysteries of the seasons and return the right weather to Arendelle.

There are 16 tiles making up a common game board for all players. Each player takes on the role of a character from the Frozen universe and aims to collect all 4 season tiles. Each player's turn consists of:

     Either moving to an adjacent tile or discarding a card and moving to any tile with that symbol on the board.
     Flipping the tile they left behind so now it shows another effect.
     Resolving the effect of the tile they have just landed on.

Name: Crypto Swintus
Description:
In today’s feverish turmoil of new currencies, corporate magnates force usually layabout hogs to work tirelessly on cryptofields, digging for different kinds of oinkoins until they are blue in their snouts. But true Swintus can overcome any hardships. All you need is simply to squander away the whole capital entrusted to you and be the first to leave on vacation. Your glorious business venture will become a legend among all lazybones of neighboring (crypto)farms.

To win the game you must be the first player to get rid of all of your cards. Winner scores an amount of points equal to number of all cards in their opponents’ hands at the end of the game. We recommend to play a series of games, up to a certain number of points, depending on the number of players. First player to get certain amount of points will be the winner of the series.

Name: your rope.
Description:
The trick-taking game å›ã®ç¸„ (your rope.) was released as part of the publisher ruri ruri games' (ã‚‹ã‚Šã‚‹ã‚Šã‚²ãƒ¼ãƒ ã‚º) Autumn 2019 box of trick-taking games, titled ãƒˆãƒªãƒ†ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆï¼• (Trick Taking Set 5).

In å›ã®ç¸„, players will earn points by lifting an oblong cardboard object with a multi-colored rope.  A player will earn more points by successfully lifting the object at more difficult points.

The cards in the game have two colored rope sections pictured in the middle, and after a hand of tricks, the player combines these sections to determine which colors of the rope the player can use to attempt to lift the object.

The player with the highest score after a number of rounds wins.

—user summary

Name: Vira Letras
Description: Turn the number of discs taken in the die and try to form words with them. In this game, you win whoever wrote the most words with the discs.

Name: Sedução
Description:
The pleasure is yours. Relationship, attraction, boldness, passion, sensuality, love and shyness. Some of the most current themes that are at stake in Seduction. You and your friends will have fun discovering what each one thinks about these and many other subjects. Get ready! You will make and hear great revelations!

The game is played in teams. To get the pawn to the end of the board, players have to perform super-creative tasks, enact various kinds of situations, make sometimes funny, sometimes indiscreet guesses, and answer questions about personal topics and general affairs. All related to the art of seducing.

Name: Arrumação
Description:
In this amazing game of speed and logic you have one goal: to put the people of your team in the marked places. But beware, it's not easy to remember who's what.

You all become objects of the house. So, before calling the next occupant of the vacant seat, think about it. If you choose the wrong person your team will be harmed!

Can you think a few rounds ahead and win the match?

Name: Pequenas Igrejas, Grandes Negócios: Ateus Graças a Deus!
Description: Dismantle the baptism with the atheism hair dryer! Create universities and increase people's education and stop buying pickaxes; join the Foundation for Science and Reason; fight creationism and put all the animals inside Noah's Ark!

Name: Pequenas Igrejas, Grandes Negócios: Oremos!
Description: The Holy Church of Peter is back. Dance with the Fathers dancers, organize and run gay saunas in Europe, say that atheists are to blame for everything while managing the chair dance of the accused pedophilia! And if nothing else resolves, call the Inquisition to take care of these heretics.

Name: Pequenas Igrejas, Grandes Negócios: Ou Dá, ou Desce!
Description: The Prosperity Supplement. Hire failed end-of-career artists, former psychopaths, ex-periguets, or failed child presenters for the Lord's Work; Lot the Maracana with the Psalms; Make Total Decapitation!

Name: Pequenas Igrejas, Grandes Negócios: Picaretas e Esquisotéricos
Description: Moorings, soul mates and crystal balls! Seek knowledge with Ets and quantum Atlantic civilizations! Untangle your enemies' chakras with Horus's Positronic Board! See your opponents cards with your Scrying table! Match RPG games to the devil and fight the Sword of the Sword Spirit! Beat the Illuminatis!

Name: Pequenas Igrejas, Grandes Negócios: Satanistas de Orkutbook
Description:
They are everywhere! The Devil in person can be used in this supplement, which consists of tricks and traps of the recesses of Cramunhão!

Adds 30 new cards to the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Pequenas Igrejas, Grandes Negócios: Vodu é pra Jacu
Description:
Face the Backrests, the Backstops, the macumbas and exorcise the Crammunion in person! Fight the fire puppies! Do an exorcism at dawn! Go down to hell fifteen times! Try to guess who has epilepsy and who has the devil in the body as you slap them! Bring the loved one in three business days in the name of Jezuis!

Adds 30 new cards to the game.

—description from the designer

Name: On Mars: Upgrade Pack
Description:
The On Mars Upgrade Pack is a bundle of extras from the On Mars Kickstarter campaign.

Expand your game with extra Contract cards, Private Goals, and a board for your Blueprint cards.

Contents:

     Blueprint Board
     12 Additional Contract Cards
     6 Private Goal Cards


—description from the publisher

Name: DC Deck-Building Game: Gorilla Grodd
Description:
Super-Villain promo for the DC Comics Deck-Building Game.

The card text:

Once during each of your turns, you may discard a card. If you do, play a card in the Line-Up with that cost or 1 higher. Return it at end of turn.

Name: Sorcerer City: Kickstarter Expansion
Description:
A selection of additional tiles, only available through the Kickstarter Deluxe Edition Tier:

The Statue Artifact: Place this tile and one other tile of your choice during the Prepare phase before the round begins. It counts as Wild for all Money, Influence, Magic, and Prestige. If you play any Monster tiles in this way, ignore the effects of those monsters.

The Potion Artifact: Before Magic is assigned, reduce your Magic by 2 and increase your Money, Influence, and Prestige each by 2. If you have less than 2 Magic, only increase the Money, Influence, and Prestige each by the amount of Magic you have.

Gazer: Tier I Monster
As soon as your draw the Gazer tile, place it in your district and them immediately draw 3 tiles at once: choose one to [play, one to discard, and one to destroy.

Spindra: Tier II Monster
Place Spindra in your city. The next tile you draw must be placed on top of Spindra.

Name: Fayre Winds & Foul Tides: A Fantastic Expansion for Galleys & Galleons
Description:
Fayre Winds & Foul Tides is an expansion for Galleys & Galleons. Whether you have a panache for lacepulp, a fetish for High Fantasy, or just want to explore new historical periods, FWFT provides everything you need the bravely sail beyond the Seven Seas.

New special rules - FWFT introduces 51 new special rules to further customise your fleets, including traitorous captains, mutinous crews, indirect fire and ironclads.

New terrain - The seas just got more dangerous with a range of new terrain features including icebergs, volcanoes and assorted native islanders.

Advanced rules for flyers - Take the fight to the skies with advanced flying rules and new types of flyers, from da Vinci inspired ornithopters and lace-pulp airships, to dragons, gryphons and flying carpets.

Magic - The tides of magic cause additional waves on the tabletop with new rules for shipborne sorcerers and magical creatures. Seven schools of magic give a range of unique spells and other magical abilities with which to destroy your foes (and confound your friends).

—description from the publisher

Name: Full Captain: Tactical Naval Wargame Rules
Description:
Full Captain is a Tactical Naval Wargame, designed to play actions between small groups of ships or individual ships. The game is specially designed for our 10mm Naval Range, which scale allows gamers to manoeuvre ships and fight actions using miniatures representing guns and crew members.

The Rules cover the entire “Golden Era” of sailing ships, from the mid XVII century to the first quarter of the XIX century.

Full Captain allows players to recreate the bloody boardings of the famous pirate “Black Beard”, the coastal actions of Privateers and smugglers against the Revenue authorities (His Majesty’s Customs & Revenue, Royal Navy, US Coast Guard and Revenue, French Gendarmerie, Spanish Navy, etc.), as well as small engagements between, single ships, ranging from Gunboats to big 74-gun ships of the line.

—description from the publisher

Name: The East West Express Race Across Australia
Description:
A simple roll-and-move race game starting in Perth on the west coast of Australia and ending in Brisbane on the east coast. Along the way delays and advances may be encountered by landing on specific numbered spots. First to reach home at Brisbane is the winner.

The graphics of biplanes on the board suggest the game dates probably post-World War 1. The Trans Australian railway linking Kalgoorlie in Western Australia across the Nullabor Plain to the eastern town of Ooldea was completed in 1917.

—user summary

Name: Mostri in Mostra
Description:
In this art gallery someone had a lot of fun messing with the monsters portraits. Maybe your opponent?
You must quickly try to recreate the portraits so that they will appear like the original ones.

You won't be using paint and brush to do it; instead you'll be handling coloured rolling marbles trying to place them in to the right place in the right order.

Place your frame, get the marbles ready and go! The fastest painter wins!

Name: Brain Elixir -- After-Dinner Riddles
Description:
Stimulate your brain with fun lateral thinking riddles in Brain Elixir After-Dinner Riddles by Clarendon Games! Includes 80 fun riddle cards.

Fun games to cure boredom!
Great for stocking stuffers and impulse
Small travel sized card games
Mixes humour and trivia

—description from the publisher

Name: Cunning Concoction: Bluff Trivia
Description:
Test your knowledge and cunning by playing Cunning Concoction Bluff Trivia by Clarendon Games! If you don’t know the answer to a trivia question, bluff without being caught out and still win the card. Includes 80 trivia cards to test your cunning and knowledge.

Fun games to cure boredom!
Great for stocking stuffers and impulse
Small travel sized card games
Mixes humour and trivia

—description from the publisher

Name: Merriment Mixture -- Categories Game
Description:
Clarendon Games' Merriment Mixture is the ultimate boredom killer. Take turns to name items in a given category against the clock. Be warned - take too long or repeat an item and you're out. Last player standing wins the card!

How many Songs by The Beatles can you name when put on the spot? It's a lot harder than it sounds. Eleanor Rigby, Love Me Do, Back In The USSR,... something about a Yellow Submarine? I don't know!

What about Words that End in '-sh'? Think fast! Fish, lash, crash, push,... is bosh a word? As in, 'bish, bash, bosh'? No?!

Can you handle yourself under pressure? Can you remember what has been said before? Keep your wits about you!

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: Deinze In Het Land Van Nevele
Description: On January 1st 2019 the two Belgian cities Deinze and Nevele were fused into ¨Deinze in het land van Nevele". To celebrate this, AD Delhaize Deinze worked together with Hasbro to create this new version of Monopoly with locations from both cities.

Name: WALDAMI
Description:
WALDAMI is a pattern recognition card game. Players start with a hand of seven cards, each of which shows a combination of two forms (inner and outer) in two colors. An example is a combination of an inner circle in white and an outer square in black and white.
The goal of the game hereby is to play all cards of ones hand.

Players do this by adding cards to the ones already played down on the table with the following rules:

     change a single shape or color (e.g. circle -> square)
     change whole pattern (e.g. inner and outer circle -> inner and outer square)
     feature inversion (e.g. inner circle and outer square -> outer square and inner circle)
     double feature in version (see 3 plus inversion of color)

Name: The Animal Trivia Game
Description:
Not to be confused with other games with similar names. Neither the publisher nor the designer is indicated, but the game comes in an envelope saying "Enclosed: Your Free Animal Triva Game", so one might imagine that it was a promotional item or was given away for free with some product or service.
There are 30 cardboard rectangles with numbers from 1 to 30, and another 30 cardboard rectangles in 6 different groups (indicated by pictures and words): birds, insects, primates, fish, mammals, and reptiles (however, the reptile rectangles have a picture of a frog on them). One of each of these 6 groups has a stars, in addition to the pictures and the names of the groups.
The two different types of squares (numbers and animals) are put into two different containers. Players (presumably without looking) take one rectangle from each container, and this determines which question (from the question sheet) they have to answer. For example, if a player drew 6 and primates, he would have to answer the question "True or False: Lemurs and lorises have huge eyes so they can see well at night". (The correct answer here is "true"). Most correct answers give the player 5 points, but if a starred rectangle was drawn,  a correct answer gives 10 points.
The game can last a chosen period of time (in which case whoever has amassed the highest total wins) or until a set target of points is reached (in which case whoever has reached that target wins).

Name: River
Description:
The aim of the game is to sail on the river and try to discover the most valuable unknown creatures (discovery cards). You can buy new tools from the cargo ship to make your search more successful and to have the most sensational publication at the end of the game.

At the beginning of each round players choose from their movement tokens the one which has a number showing how far they want to move. You cannot reuse it until you run out of the other movement tokens. You can move your ship forward or backwards on the river as far as the selected movement token shows.

If your ship lands on a tile with a buoy, take a look at the card at the top of the discovery deck. If the card shows a tool that you own, you are lucky! Keep the card. On the other side of the card, you can see your new discovery and the number of victory points/score. The player with the highest number of victory points at the end wins the game.

Name: 惑星たちの帰り道 (Planet Go Round)
Description:
æƒ‘æ˜ŸãŸã¡ã®å¸°ã‚Šé“ (Wakusei Tachi no Kaeri Michi) (Planet Go Round) is a Japanese memory game.

"God of our universe has drunken oveeeer!?"
Each player is the god of other various universes.
Let's hand the planets around between players and get them back to their own solar-system!

An easy memory game, which children aged five can easily play. Designed for children, but adults can also play seriously.

Planet Go Round is an open memory game. As cards are turned up from the deck, all the players get to see them. Then the card is given to a player's hand. There are four cards in each of seven suites. If a player receives a duplicate card into their hand, the paradox damages the Universe. They pay a penalty chip to the person who gave them the card.

The player with the fewest chips at the end is the winner. So players are trying to distribute the cards to other players without drawing a penalty to themselves. This means they must remember what cards others are holding or have discarded.

There is a Challenge mode too, if a player can get all seven suites into their discards.

ã€Œç§ãŸã¡ã®å®‡å®™ã®ç¥žæ§˜ãŒé…”ã„ã¤ã¶ã‚Œã¡ã‚ƒã£ãŸã€œï¼ï¼Ÿã€
å„ãƒ—ãƒ¬ã‚¤ãƒ¤ãƒ¼ã¯æ§˜ã€…ãªåˆ¥ã®ä¸–ç•Œã®ç¥žæ§˜ã§ã™ã€‚
ã¿ã‚“ãªã§æ©‹æ¸¡ã—ã‚’ã—ã¦ã€æƒ‘æ˜ŸãŸã¡ã‚’å¤ªé™½ç³»ã«ã‚‚ã©ãã†ï¼

5æ­³ã‹ã‚‰ã§ã‚‚å‡ºæ¥ã‚‹ã€ãŠæ‰‹è»½ãƒ¡ãƒ¢ãƒªãƒ¼ã‚²ãƒ¼ãƒ ã€‚
ã‚­ãƒƒã‚ºå‘ã‘ã€ã§ã‚‚å¤§äººã‚‚æœ¬æ°—ã§éŠã¹ã¾ã™ï¼
ãƒ¡ã‚«ãƒ‹ã‚ºãƒ ã¨ã—ã¦ã¯å„ãƒ—ãƒ¬ã‚¤ãƒ¤ãƒ¼ã®æ‰‹æœ­ã¨æ¨ã¦æœ­ã‚’æš—è¨˜ã—ãªãŒã‚‰ã€7ç¨®å„4æžšã‚ã‚‹ã‚«ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’é‡è¤‡ã—ãªã„ã‚ˆã†ã«æ¸¡ã—ã¦ã„ãå…¨å…¬é–‹ã®æš—è¨˜ã‚²ãƒ¼ãƒ ã§ã™ã€‚
publisher's summary

Easy instruction of the rules:
Each player draw a card from deck in his turn. The player should reveal this newly drawn card to all other players. Then the player must give this card to any other player.
If that player already has same card of given in his hand...
... a paradox happens and his universe explodes!
Then the player who gave that card gains meteor token.
When the meteor token in the token pool runs out, the game ends and the player who has the fewest tokens wins!

However, what you can do when there is no one safe to give it to? Indeed! If you suspect every player already has same card which you have to give, you can discard it instead of giving. Additionally, a player can hold only two cards in his hand, therefore, when a player who already holds two cards is given a card, he must discard the oldest card. For this reason, surely you will be confused if the card you saw before has been discarded, or not...!

Additionally, you can perform a 'challenge!' before draw a card. When you try a 'challenge', check a player's discard pile. If all 7 suits are included in the discard pile, you pass the test, and you can return a meteor token back to token pool. Do your best to memorize each players' hands and discarded cards!

Background Story:
This universe is in danger! Specifically, it explodes!

One day, the Gods have come to hold a party. The guests of honor of this party are the planets that the gods brought up under their own care. So, the party became lively! It was good so far, but ...

The god of solar-system, your universe, has drunk too much and fallen asleep. Oh my gosh, good heavens, the planets cannot get back to their proper places without their god. Under this situation... you are the gods of other universes.

Please, players must co-operate, and let the planets go back to their solar-system by handing over the right planets among the players. But beware, if a god bears same two planets at a time, a paradox happens, and one of universes explodes, the planet becoming a meteor. So, which god performs best in this accident?
user summary

Name: Narrow Seas! Fast Play Tactical Naval Rules for WWII Coastal Forces Actions
Description:
Narrow Seas is a fast playing set of coastal forces naval rules designed for use with models from 1/300 to 1/1200. Book keeping is minimal, with speed and damage recorded for each vessel on a card through a series of Levels rather than keeping track of damage points and exact speeds.
As well as rules for gunnery, torpedo and depth charge attacks there are optional and additional rules covering anti submarine warfare, boarding actions and battles involving forces on land.

Data for over 200 classes and individual ships and over 70 aircraft types covering the navies of Great Britain, Germany, the United States, Japan, France, Italy, the Soviet Union, the Netherlands, Finland, Bulgaria, Romania and Tito’s Partisan navy are included.

—description from the publisher

Name: Desítka Česko
Description:
Desítka ÄŒesko is a variant of Smart10 game, based on questions about Czech republic.

It is a quiz game where a player doesn't need to wait for one's turn for long.
There are ten possible answers to each question, and every player gets to answer every question.
If the answer is correct, the player gets an answer marker.
But should you answer or pass?
If you don't score your answer markers on time (and thereby pass on this round), you can end up losing them.
So if you are not 100% certain of an answer - do you gamble or do you pass?
Plays great in teams.

Name: Common Threads
Description:
Common Threads is the family card game that lets you play four different games with the same deck! Featuring cool characters and colorful graphics, each card in the deck matches in one way. It's up to you to spot the matching elements, play your cards quickly and outsmart your opponents. Cards feature quirky characters -- like a unicorn, robot, dinosaur and more -- dressed in colorful outfits and accessories. Do two different cards show the same character? That's a match. Are two different characters wearing the same color shirt? That's a match. Are two different characters each holding a skateboard? That's a match! But act quickly, because each game is based on how fast you can spot the matching elements. This fast-paced family card game is lots of fun for 7 year olds and up.

-from the publisher's website

Name: Mystery Tonic: One Minute Mysteries
Description: In less than one minute, players will hear a succinct mystery. As clues are revealed, players must use their deductive skills and quick wit to correctly solve the mystery before anyone else can.

Name: Fistful of Lead: Wasteland Warriors
Description:
Fistful of Lead: Wasteland Warriors is designed as a quick set of tabletop wargame rules for skirmishes in the Post Apocalyptic future. The rules are easy to learn and still keep the flavor of the genre.

There are full rules for building your gang of humans, robots, and mutants, and sending them on campaigns. The book includes rules for mutations and creatures that stalk the Wastelands.

What separates Wasteland Warriors from most tabletop miniature games on the marker is the unique card driven turn mechanism. This leads to snap decisions and tense moments where all the players are involved.

For Wasteland Warriors we wanted the play to be fast and furious, with a Hollywood flair to it. For that reason, record keeping is kept to a bare minimum.

In most games, each player can control up to 5-6 miniatures without much trouble. Games can have up to 8 players without slowing down the game. Now, you can dig out all your old miniatures gathering dust and have a game set in the Wastelands of the future.

Experienced wargamers and new players alike will enjoy this game. It’s perfect for convention games and just one on one skirmishes.

—description from the publisher

Name: PURE PROFIT Card Game
Description:
Do you want to be the RICHEST player?

Play cards and try to be the first player to build your BANK to the highest value of $10 million. Play a STEAL card to try and grab the card you need from another player or hang on to a card you know another player needs. While doing all that try not to go BANKRUPT before another player finishes their BANK and wins the game! Win the game and you can say, "It's all pure profit!"

-description from designer

Name: Galaxy Challenge Board Game
Description:
Will you be the first to find all hidden Anomalies in the galaxy?

We have evolved into stellar explorers and deep space is our home where we live and work in the dark, vast universe. We have discovered friend and foe along the way and we learn to survive. Become one of 6 space faring civilizations and explore the galaxy and be the first to discover its hidden Anomalies to win the game. Or rocket through the galaxy attacking anyone who gets in your way, to gain extra advantages or challenge them for one of their previously discovered Anomalies. Collect one anomaly chip for every discovery made. Collect the most chips and you win!

Name: A la Mesa!
Description:
All famous chefs are cooking tonight only for me!

A la mesa is a creative cooking game designed by Josep M. Allué and Yohan Goh. In a round, one player takes the role of a "guest", while the other players become chefs and draft four ingredient cards. Before doing this, the guest draws as many condition cards as the number of chefs, then gives one card to each chef.

After drafting their ingredients, each chef presents their dish, explaining how they prepared it, after which the guest awards victory tokens according to their favor. Then another player becomes the guest to play the next round.

The game ends after each player has finished their three dishes, and whoever has collected the most victory tokens wins.

—description from publisher

Name: Twilight of the Sun King: Scenario Book 3 – Louis XIV vs the Grand Alliance
Description:
Twilight of the Sun King – Scenario Book 3 – Louis XIV vs the Grand Alliance 15 battle scenarios from the War of the Grand Alliance (1688-97) and the War of the Spanish Succession (1701-14).

Recommended optional and amended rules are included for pursuit, replacing commanders, using D6 and an alternative play sequence. Finally also includes are modified quick reference play sheets for the above changes and also one for this era only, i.e. without unit types not used in these wars.

This booklet features the following scenarios.

The War of the Grand Alliance (1688-97)


     Walcourt, 1689
     Staffarda, 1690
     Aughrim, 1691
     Steenkirk, 1692
     Ter River/Torroella, 1694


The War of the Spanish Succession (1701-14)


     Chiari, 1701
     Friedlingen, 1702
     Hochstadt, 1703
     The Schellenberg, 1704
     Cassano, 1705
     Turin, 1706
     Oudenaarde, 1708
     Malplaquet, 1709
     Saragossa, 1710
     Villaviciosa, 1710


—description from the publisher
Families: History: War of the Spanish Succession

Name: Play the Thirty Years War 1618-1648
Description:
Project made possible by the great and beautiful collection of Gianpaolo Bistulfi, who in many years of modelling career has personally painted thousands of toy soldiers. Now these soldiers will be at your disposal to obtain, with little effort, entire armies of battalions of infantry, squadrons of cavalry, batteries of cannons, houses and buildings, trees and much more material needed to create the scenes of your battle. We also explain tricks and modes for a good assembly of the pieces, as well as the official rules for playing wargame. All in 50 pages full of hundreds of soldiers supplied in the standard scale of 25/28mm that you can, for personal use only, photocopy on thicker cardboard and thus get armed with the desired size. So what are you waiting for? Wear the general commander’s shoulder pads, equip yourself with a capable table, a practical ruler to measure, a pair of dice and get ready to lead hundreds or thousands of armed in epic and exciting battles of history!

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Series: Paper Battles and Dioramas (Soldiershop Publishing)

Name: Play the Burgundian War 1474-1477
Description:
Project made possible by the great and beautiful collection of Gianpaolo Bistulfi, who in many years of modelling career has personally painted thousands of toy soldiers. Now these soldiers will be at your disposal to obtain, with little effort, entire armies of battalions of infantry, squadrons of cavalry, batteries of cannons, houses and buildings, trees and much more material needed to create the scenes of your battle. We also explain tricks and modes for a good assembly of the pieces, as well as the official rules for playing wargame. All in 50 pages full of hundreds of soldiers supplied in the standard scale of 25/28mm that you can, for personal use only, photocopy on thicker cardboard and thus get armed with the desired size. So what are you waiting for? Wear the general commander’s shoulder pads, equip yourself with a capable table, a practical ruler to measure, a pair of dice and get ready to lead hundreds or thousands of armed in epic and exciting battles of history!

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Paper Battles and Dioramas (Soldiershop Publishing)

Name: Fistful of Lead: Viva la Revolucion! – Wargaming the Mexican Revolution
Description:
Viva la Revolucion! is a Scenario Supplement for Fistful of Lead for the Mexican Revolution. Not only do you get period specific rules, but 10 scenarios that follow the timeline of the war. It's the Wild West meets the new Industrial Age of warfare.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sử Hộ Vương: A Vietnamese legendary trading card game
Description:
With Su Ho Vuong, you will own the Tiger with the ability to summon and accompany the legendary characters including demons, gods, heroes, kings, queens, princesses, craft ancestors. , ... will fight together with another force to protect the country - the land of "Con Rong Chau Tien" (the Dragon's son and the Fairy's nephew).

Su Ho Vuong is the first trading card game in Vietnam. Each person builds for himself a set of 30 cards.

Currently, there are over 200 different cards, including 100 Guardian Gods, 60 Treasures and 40 Tactical cards.

The game has 2 game modes:

     Team boss fights: from 1 to 6 people
     Countervailing: divided into 2 teams fighting each other, playing 2 or 4 or 6 people.


—description from the publisher

Name: El juego de Félix Rodríguez de la Fuente
Description:
Félix Rodríguez de la Fuente was the most important nature broadcaster in Spain, during the 60s to 80s and is considered the main responsible for the development of nature conservation in Spain.

The players guide their Félix figures and several animal tokens across the game board and answer multiple questions on the most relevant animal species in the Iberian ecosystems.

The board consists of a track with spaces associated to the different species. Players roll a die and move their animal tokens along the track and when they stop on particular places they get a question. If the player answers a question correctly he/she can move the Félix figure along a different track. The final aim of the game is to reach the refuge of other player with your own Félix figure.

This is a family game for nature lovers, and when buying it you colaborate with "Fundación Félix Rodriguez de la Fuente" for the development of its projects.

Name: Phoque!
Description:
You can write it anyway ... in the end it has to mean the same thing.

Answer questions to which there is no good answer and collect more points by matching your answers with those of other players.

How we play PHOQUE!

Draw a card and read it aloud.

Everyone writes their answer.

We compare answer and every one that looks the same gets points.

If you're really hot, you might get bonus points!

Here is in very summary how the 5 types of card are played:

There is not really a good answer. Each player scores one (1) point for each answer identical.

A question related to the reader. Each player scores one (1) point per answer identical to another player and two (2) additional points if you have the same answer as the reader.

A question related to one of the players. Each player scores one (1) point for each answer identical to another player.

A question where you have to find the common point between two things, people, objects, etc. Each player scores one (1) point for each answer identical to another player and two (2) additional points if you have found the answer on the card.



Vous aurez beau l’écrire de toutes les façons... à la fin du compte faut que ça dise la même affaire.Répondez à des questions auxquelles il n’y a pas vraiment de bonne réponse et ramassez plus de points en matchant vos réponses avec celles des autres joueurs.

Comment on joue à PHOQUE!

Pige une carte et lis-la à voix haute.

Tout le monde écrit sa réponse..

On compare les réponses des joueurs et tous ceux qui en ont une pareille font des points.

Si t’es vraiment hot, t’auras peut-être des points boni!

Voici en très résumé comment se jouent les 5 types de carte :

Il n’y a pas vraiment de bonne réponse. Chaque joueur marque un (1) point par réponse identique à un autre joue.

Les questions qui ont un lien avec le lecteur. Chaque joueur marque un (1) point par réponse identique à un autre joueur et deux (2) points supplémentaires si vous avez la même réponse que le lecteur.

Les questions qui ont un lien avec l’un des joueurs. Chaque joueur marque un (1) point par réponse identique à un autre joueur.

Les questions où devez trouver le point commun entre deux choses, personnes, objets, etc. Chaque joueur marque un (1) point par réponse identique à un autre joueur et deux (2) points supplémentaires si vous avez trouvé la réponse de la carte.

Name: Munchkin Warhammer 40,000: Chaos Dice
Description:
Nothing says Chaos like these random number generators (as long as you only need numbers from 1 to 6). These six attractive dice will add an extra dose of Chaos to any Munchkin game . . . and they come with four new Munchkin Warhammer 40,000 cards!

—description from the publisher

Name: Dead + Gone
Description:
A two player competitive horror game, one person takes on the role of a monster aiming to kill, while the other takes on a spirit aiming to destroy minds. Both aim to rid the house of any and all occupants. Both vie to destroy the most residents.

A house is populated with a pool of various, randomly-drawn residents, with each resident having their own mental and physical health trackers. An event card is drawn that impacts the night (anything from damage being doubled, to new characters arriving at the house).  The players then play a card from own hand that affects the mental and/or physical health of the resident they chose to attack that night. Should there be at least one resident still alive in the house at the end of both attacks, the next night begins.

At the end of each consecutive third night the next act begins, allowing players to use more vicious attacks, and on the third act, each player draws a horror card, granting them a unique action or event. The game continues until all residents in the house are dead - and the player with the most victims wins -  unless specific events or characters get drawn that could lead to the demise of one, or both players.

Name: Munchkin 6: Double Dungeons
Description:
Double Trouble!
What's an adventurer without dungeons to explore? This box contains 40 double-sized Dungeons plus 32 Portals to get you from one to the next. Each Dungeon changes the rules... some are helpful, some are harmful, and some are just silly. It's Munchkin, after all!

This set includes the cards from Munchkin 6: Demented Dungeons and Munchkin 6.5: Terrible Tombs, now in a single convenient expansion!

-from publisher's website

Name: Kaptein Sabeltann: Sjørøverspillet
Description:
Compete with the other pirates (and Captain Sabretooth) to find and captures the most diamonds.

Each player rolls a dice and moves the pirate ship the corresponding number of spaces. You can steal from another pirate, forfeit your turn, or go hunting for a chest full of diamonds.

When hunting for diamonds, the player draws a treasure map. The map contains the number of diamonds the player must randomly choose from a treasure chest filled with diamonds in different colors. The treasure map also shows which diamond Captain Sabretooth will steal from you.

The pirate with most diamonds in the end, wins the game.

Name: Fast Play Rules for Ancient Warfare
Description:
Miniatures battle game. Meant to handle large battles in a relatively brief time, although rumour has it that the "Fast Play" part is more aspiration than reality.

—user summary

Name: Capsule Hole
Description:
Capsule Hole (ã‚«ãƒ—ã‚»ãƒ«ãƒ›ãƒ¼ãƒ«) has a hint of a trick-taking element to it, but for the most part players are trying to score points by having the most influence in a capsule when it's closed.

The game consists of forty tiles numbered 1-40, with the tiles being grouped in four buckets on their backs: 1-10, 11-20, 21-30, and 31-40. Players draft tiles at the start of the game while seeing only their backs; tiles in the first group have a "capsule opening" on only one edge, while tiles in the second group have a straight or curved tube from one edge to another, and tiles in the fourth group generally have three or four open edges. You can look at the faces of your tiles are you draft them.

The start player in a round plays one tile of their choice, optionally placing one of their wooden cubes on it. Each other player in turn must place one of their tiles in the same group (if possible) face down in front of them, again optionally placing one of their wooden cubes on it. Players then reveal their tiles, then add them to the shared playing area, starting with whoever has the highest-numbered tile. If you placed a cube on your tile, you then place this cube somewhere on your tile in one of the capsules.

When a capsule is closed, akin to a road being closed in Carcassonne, whichever players have the most cubes in it score points equal to the number of energy symbols in that capsule. After all the tiles have been played, whoever has the highest score wins — except that if exactly one player has scored 0 points, then they win instead!

Name: Deadpan
Description:
Deadpan is game centered around holding your composure while abiding by hilarious rules that players draw from the deck. Players take tuns drawing one card from the deck. The object of the game is to not laugh when it is your turn to read a "Statement" card or read/answer a "Response" card all while trying to follow your own rules cards in your hand at all times.

In the deck are "Response" cards that the drawer must ask another player of their choosing, in which that player must respond, and there are "Statement" cards which the drawer must simply read out loud. What makes Deadpan unique are the hilarious rules cards that are also in the deck. When a player draws a rule card, they must abide by the rule at all times, even when it is not their turn.

The "Response" and "Statement" cards act as points. To score the "Statement" point, the drawer must successfully read the "Statement" card without laughing while following any rules in their hand. To score the "Response" card, the drawer must ask the question to another player of their choice while trying not to laugh and following their own rules. If the responding player is able to respond without laughing and follows their own rules, then they are awarded the point. If the responder fails, then the drawer who asked the question is awarded the point. If both fail, no one is awarded the point. If a player is caught not following their rules at any time, they lose one (if any) of their points.  First player to collect seven points is the winner.

There are "Mannerism" - rules that implement a type of action a player must do as directed by the card, "Starters..."- implements that a player must start each sentence they speak with the statement on the card, "...Enders" - implements that a player must end each sentence they speak with the statement on the card, and "New Name" - implements that the player must refer to the directed player on the card by the name on the card anytime they address that player. There are also DEADPAN rules in the deck - These are the same categories as normal rules, but the difference being they are more over the top and the drawer gets to assign the DEADPAN rules to other players.

In the deck are also "Veto" cards and "Revenge" cards. "Veto" enables a player to discard any regular rule from anyone's hand. "Revenge" cards give the player the opportunity for payback towards any player that has given them a DEADPAN rule.

—description from the designer

Name: Bigger is Better
Description:
Bigger is Better
The Game Where Size Matters
 This is the game of measurement... biggest to smallest, heaviest to lightest, longest to shortest. Try and put everything in the right order. In this game, guessing is half the fun!

Will you choose a pickle, a hot dog, a candy cane, or a hamburger?

Can you sort these by distance from longest to shortest?
Distance a bullfrog can jump
Distance a cat can leap
Distance a camel can spit
Human male world record pee distance

Name: Red Hatchets and Black Powder: A Fistful of Lead – Horse & Musket Supplement for the French & Indian War
Description:
Red Hatchets & Black Powder allows you to play a small scale wargame in the woods and wilds of North America during the French and Indian War.
You'll take on the role of a Captain or War Leader, either leading a troop of brave soldiers, stalwart Rangers, terrified militia or stealthy Natives.Red Hatchets & Black Powder is supplement to Fistful of Lead: Horse & Musket, and is not a stand alone game. You will need a copy of Fistful of Lead: Horse & Musket to play.
Included are 10 scenarios, special rules for the French and Indian War, as well as rules for building your forces.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fistful of Lead: For a Fistful More
Description:
For a Fistful More - Scenarios for Fistful of Lead

Strap on your shootin' irons, and step into the Wild West!  What's in this book....

20 Action-packed scenarios for the Fistful of Lead, Wild West wargaming rules.
Included are:


     2 multi-part linked scenarios
     Lots of one-off, stand alone scenarios
     5 character driven scenarios
     The special "Revenge of Boot Hill", which allows you to add a little "weird" to your Wild West


While written with Fistful of Lead in mind, you can easily adapt these scenarios to your own rules.

—description from publisher
